thread.title: Kings GM Vlade Divac claims he had better offer for DeMarcus Cousins two days ago
thread.title_full: Kings GM Vlade Divac claims he had better offer for DeMarcus Cousins two days ago

author: Dan Sostek (daniel.sostek@performgroup.com)
title: Kings GM Vlade Divac claims he had better offer for DeMarcus Cousins two days ago
text:
February 20, 2017 4:25pm EST February 20, 2017 4:16pm EST Kings GM Vlade Divac admitted in a press conference Thursday that there was a better trade offer for DeMarcus Cousins than the one he eventually settled for. DeMarcus Cousins. (Getty Images) 
Updated at 4:25 p.m. ET 
Updated at 4:25 p.m. ET 
If last night's trade of DeMarcus Cousins made some Kings fans want to bury their heads in a pillow, Sacramento general manager Vlade Divac's press conference probably didn't help matters. 
Divac acknowledged on Monday afternoon that he received a stronger proposal two days before he eventually dealt Cousins , but that the offer was off the table by Sunday. 
"I had a better deal two days ago," Divac said. "Talk to those agents. I don't want to go into details. I don't want to discuss about the process. It was a big process for us." Yep, Vlade actually said this. pic.twitter.com/CEW7aynAZ2 â€” Dieter Kurtenbach (@dkurtenbach) February 20, 2017 
The Kings eventually settled for a package of Buddy Hield, Tyreke Evans, Langston Galloway, and 2017 first and second round picks. The Kings also shipped out forward Omri Casspi. 
The acknowledgment that the Kings had a better offer is a shocking one. 
While Divac insinuated the offer was taken off the table, you'd think that Sacramento would be a little less rash in trading their superstar with five days still remaining until the NBA trade deadline, rather than settling for what many believe to be a failure of a haul for an All-Star center.
